ext_descriptions.ext_description: A metal_or_dielectric lists the values for metal or dielectric.
specifies that value is over finished conductor;
specifies that value is over finished dielectric;

A Fabrication_thickness_requirement_occurrence is a type of
that characterizes the interconnect thickness range over metallic material or dielectric material and assigns a tolerance to that range for fabrication purposes.

specifies a role of the
for the Fabrication_thickness_requirement_occurrence. The tolerance is applicable over the range specified by the characterized_class_range.
specifies a role of the for the Fabrication_thickness_requirement_occurrence. The characterized_class_range specifies the measurements to which the tolerance applies.

specifies the
for the Fabrication_thickness_requirement_occurrence. This is the class to which the range and tolerance is applied.
The .. shall be 'test'.

The
shall not be populated.

A Layout_land_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence is a type of
that characterizes the land width range that is required to be produced for a particular terminal pitch class of mating components.

ext_description.p:
specifies the largest negative
allowed width deviation for the Layout_land_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence. The deviation is measured at the surface of the that mates with the external device.
ext_description.note:
The measurement location deviates from normal fabrication practice of measuring at the base of the
in order to guarantee successful assembly process.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a role of the
for the Layout_land_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence.
The .. shall be 'test'.

ext_description.p: A Pitch_class is a category in which a particular group of may fall, depending on the value of their paired spacing. The Pitch_class controls the width of the mating feature which is measured perpendicular to the primary axis of a terminal in the class. The only type permitted in the range is a .
ext_description.example: The Pitch_class is included so that tolerances may be applied to all members of the same class, and specified only once. E.g., all pitchs with a design spacing greater than 50 mils and less than 75 mils are in the 'big' class.
ext_description.note: Other Application Objects will be populated in order to apply the class property to tolerances of the product being designed .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies a string for the Pitch_class.
specifies a role of the for the Pitch_class. The range specifies the spacings which are included as a member of the Pitch_class. The shall use for the .
The members of of class_member shall be Length_data_elements.

A Layout_line_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence is a type of
that characterizes the line width range that is expected by the design organization to be manufactured for a particular .

specifies the largest positive
for the Layout_line_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence.

specifies the largest negative
for the Layout_line_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence.

specifies a role of the
for the Layout_line_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence.

specifies a role of the
for the Layout_line_width_tolerance_requirement_occurrence.
The .. shall be 'test'.

ext_description.p: A Line_width_class is a category which assigns a name to a length range for classification purposes. The used as the basis for the range shall be a .
ext_description.example: The Line_width_class may be exchanged so that tolerances may be applied to all members of the same class, and specified only once. E.g., all lines with a design width greater than 50 mils and less than 75 mils are in the 'big' class. All members of 'big' shall have a tolerance of +5/-5 mils. Other Application Objects must be populated in order to apply the tolerances to the class.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies a string for the Line_width_class.
specifies a role of the for the Line_width_class. The shall provide length data.
The members of of class_member shall be Length_data_elements.
